intro: Torrubia obtusata, commonly known as the blunt-leaved torrubia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodlands and stream banks. The plant has alternate, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually hairless and have a bluish-green hue. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
